title: Conservative Pro Forma Analysis
summary: A methodical approach to creating realistic financial projections that account for market fluctuations and unexpected expenses, ensuring investment decisions are based on worst-case scenarios rather than best-case possibilities.
key_points: Always use actual T-12 operating statements as your baseline, not seller projections
Add 5-10% to historical expenses to account for inflation and unexpected costs
Use market vacancy rates plus 2-3% in your calculations, never assume full occupancy
Calculate management fees at market rates even if self-managing
Include reserves for capital expenditures based on property age and condition
Project rent increases conservatively based on historical data, not aspirational goals
Stress test your assumptions with higher interest rates and lower occupancy scenarios
examples: For a 1970s building with deferred maintenance, allocating 7-10% of gross income for CapEx reserves
Using 92% economic occupancy when market average is 95% to build in safety margin
Calculating debt coverage ratio at 1.3 instead of lender-required 1.25 to ensure buffer
